title: Electrostatics - Calculating E from vector sum

content.question: Which of the following best represents the magnitude of the electric field at Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi> </math> due to all four charged objects?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.3 times 10 to the 6 power, newtons per coulomb" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>

<math alttext="5.1 times 10 to the 6 power, newtons per coulomb" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>

<math alttext="7.2 times 10 to the 6 power, newtons per coulomb" overflow="scroll"><mn>7.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="5.1 times 10 to the 6 power, newtons per coulomb" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>C</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
